required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock: Bariatric surgery patients have a variable course of weight loss, maintenance and regain. Time restricted eating is an approach that may help individuals lose weight and improve metabolic functioning. We propose a pilot 12-week trial of a 10-hour time restricted eating intervention among post-bariatric surgery patients. The intervention would consist of weekly sessions for 4 weeks, followed by one session every two weeks through 12 weeks, with weight change as the primary outcome.

detailed_description.textblock: We propose a pilot 12-week trial of a 10-hour time restricted eating intervention among post-bariatric surgery patients. The intervention would consist of weekly sessions for 4 weeks, followed by one session every two weeks through 12 weeks, with weight change as the primary outcome. We will provide behavioral weight loss education to the patients and monitor how many calories they are taking in once per week.

primary_outcome.description: Compare changes in body weight over 12 weeks in 10 bariatric patients who have undergone bariatric surgery and have completed the pilot study.

secondary_outcome.description: Compare changes from baseline to the end of the 12-week intervention in systolic blood pressure.
Compare changes from baseline to the end of the 12-week intervention in diastolic blood pressure.

arm_group.description: To test the effects of a 10-hour time restricted eating intervention before and after the 12 weeks of treatment on weight (primary), caloric and macronutrient intake, and a variety of psychosocial measures, including sleep, physical activity, blood pressure and eating behaviors (all secondary).

intervention.description: We propose a pilot and feasibility trial of a 10 hour time restricted eating intervention among post-bariatric surgery patients.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participants will be at least two years post bariatric surgery who have completed participation in an ongoing longitudinal assessment study of bariatric patients at our medical center.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participants who were non-compliant with the previous assessment trial, as well as those who were diagnosed with an eating disorder at their final (2 year) assessment visit. We will exclude participants at the discretion of the investigators who have unstable psychiatric issues or would be too ill to participate.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Director, Center for Weight and Eating Disorders

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

group.title: Intervention
group.description: To test the effects of a 10-hour time restricted eating intervention before and after the 12 weeks of treatment on weight (primary), caloric and macronutrient intake, and a variety of psychosocial measures, including sleep, physical activity, blood pressure and eating behaviors (all secondary). Time restricted feeding: We propose a pilot and feasibility trial of a 10 hour time restricted eating intervention among post-bariatric surgery patients.

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Weight
outcome.description: Compare changes in body weight over 12 weeks in 10 bariatric patients who have undergone bariatric surgery and have completed the pilot study.
outcome.population: Six participants enrolled, and 5 completed the trial. We included 5 participants who had more than one data point to calculate weight change.

group.title: Intervention
group.description: To test the effects of a 10-hour time restricted eating intervention before and after the 12 weeks of treatment on weight (primary), caloric and macronutrient intake, and a variety of psychosocial measures, including sleep, physical activity, blood pressure and eating behaviors (all secondary). Time restricted feeding: We propose a pilot and feasibility trial of a 10 hour time restricted eating intervention among post-bariatric surgery patients.

measure.title: Weight
measure.description: Compare changes in body weight over 12 weeks in 10 bariatric patients who have undergone bariatric surgery and have completed the pilot study.
measure.population: Six participants enrolled, and 5 completed the trial. We included 5 participants who had more than one data point to calculate weight change.

outcome.title: Systolic Blood Pressure
outcome.description: Compare changes from baseline to the end of the 12-week intervention in systolic blood pressure.
outcome.population: Six participants started the intervention, and we analyzed data from 5 participant who provided blood pressure measurements before and after the intervention

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: This was a small, unfunded feasibility study of this protocol. There was no control group, and no statistical tests were run to test significance.

point_of_contact.organization: Perelman School of Medicine at the University of Pennsylvania
